title: NO POTTING UP METHOD FOR TOMATO SEEDLINGS  - One Cup Method for Huge Tomatoes

subtasks: Gather materials (solo cups, seed starting mix, vermiculite)
Drill holes in the bottom of the solo cups for drainage
Fill solo cups halfway with moist seed starting mix
Plant tomato seeds on the surface and cover with a quarter inch of soil
Sprinkle vermiculite on top to retain moisture and prevent damping off
Use a tray with a three-inch rim to contain the cups and ensure proper bottom watering
Water the cups by filling the tray with two to three inches of water, allowing excess to drain off
Use grow lights to provide sufficient light for seedling growth
Pot up tomato seedlings by trimming bottom leaves and fill cups to the top with potting soil
Harden off tomato plants by moving them to a sunny location a few weeks before outdoor planting
Plant hardened-off tomato plants in the garden after last frost date
